reviewText: This one has plenty of it, and is an utter dung heap picture-wise. This qualifies as the second worst picture I have ever seen on a dvd movie. It does have the honer, however, of being the worst picture without pixelation. Oh, it might have had pixelation as well, but once I seen the picture was so bad I was scarcely interested in seeing if things got worse. Needless to say I couldn't comment on anything about the plot, having just jumped around in places. Shelley Fabares's hair is just pitiful here too (terribly stringy and kinky), but I think her hair was pretty much like that throughout the Coach series too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just figure this film as being a family DVD meant for watching with the entire family, and nobody asks any questions because it is so simple and stupid that a two year old could star in the lead role.  But some people don't like movies that give them nightmares, and some people don't like lots and lots of nudity or sex, sex, sex, sex.  Some people don't want to see blood and guts, mutilations, or decapitations - nor anybody hanging on a meat hook.  Some people don't want to see explosions, killing, or odd stuff that can't be logically explained.  This movie doesn't have any of that.  In fact, if you don't want to see ANY of that type of stuff, and you hate quality acting, this movie is the ideal choice.  If you never want to have to use your brain except for breathing and heartbeat in automatic mode, then no worries, this movie will let you stay at that level and still sit in front of the TV while "The Canterville Ghost" is being broadcasted onto the TV screen by the DVD player.  Going to sleep while sitting in front of the TV set would actually be better than having to watch this all the way through.  If you lost half your brain in a car accident and was injured in a military battle on the other side of your brain so that you only drool and can't speak, you're still able to get all the good there is to be had out of this movie.  Even my dad would be thrilled with this movie, not to put too fine a point on it.  It is just another example of costumes, sets, and potentially good actors that are given bad scripts, directed poorly, the movie getting edited poorly, and for all the possibilities for something worthwhile, successful effort was applied with enough enthusiasm that this movie sucks more than a Kirby.  I actually felt intelligence drain from my brain trying to get down to this level of watching it, and although I watched this DVD to the end of the movie, I'm ashamed I did.  There's an hour I could have spent doing ANYTHING else, but wasted instead.  It's kind of like making peanut butter cookies with chocolate drops in them, but burning them so black and hard that you have to throw them away.  Which wouldn't be as bad if you quit after the first batch, and didn't burn the entire lump of cookie dough; cookie sheet after cookie sheet after cookie sheet - until it was all in the trash.  You got the same good out of making those cookies as I did watching this movie.  I wonder what connections and relation those people were to the producers and marketers of this DVD, because I know they HAD to have strong ties in there somewhere.  Movies like this are not made without a reason.  Must have been charity because it's too big of a leap for it to just be a random act of kindness and let those people star in a DVD movie.  Movies like this is why most guys refuse to watch the TV channels that carry it.  Heck if I want my brain to go numb, I'd rather do it with a couple six packs and half a dozen Jello shots of vodka.  But this movie can get the job done if you're out of alternative options. Oscar Wilde wrote this story in 1887 and it has been adapted many, many times with a variety of casts. Although there is symbolism and hidden themes intended to make this story worthwhile, this version not only misses the bull's eye, it doesn't even make it anywhere onto the target.  Do yourself a favor and get a different version, with a better cast.  Shouldn't be too tough.  There are at least eleven versions from 1944 to present day, and this DVD was released in 1990, with Richard Kiley as the ghost.  Skip this version, and find one worth your time.
summary: This was never meant to be anything beyond meh

reviewText: I didn't care to much for this version. It jumps into the story and seems to skip to the middle and end a little too soon for me. It's a shorter version then the one I like, and I think that's way it kind of jumps into it.

reviewText: This is one of several movies made under this title. I have found this and two others to be my favorites.

reviewText: This one is much closer to Oscar Wilds original story. I really liked the ghost, and the girl. I currently have five different versions of the story and am expecting a cartoon version in the mail from Netflix any day now. I guess I'm just weird, I like the story. I like reading it and every couple of months I have a Canterville marathon. I start by reading Oscar Wilds original story then watch all the Canterville movies one after another.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Granted, this is an unsophisticated version of the story, but it possesses a certain charm.  It would be great for children.  There's a few hints to things more "mature", but well played.  I'd seen it many years ago and being a fan of Richard Kiley's, it was a "must have"!  A bonus was seeing the details of a fine old castle.
summary: The Canterville Ghost with Richard Kiley
